channel.title: Inference — AI Newsletter
channel.description: The signal in the noise. Curated AI trends, tools, and research — updated every Monday.

item.title: AI Industry Rivals Are Teaming Up on a Startup Accelerator
item.description: Major tech companies like OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google are collaborating to create F/ai, a startup accelerator focused on AI innovation.
item.author: Joel Khalili

item.title: A Small-Scale System for Autoregressive Program Synthesis Enabling Controlled Experimentation
item.description: A new system called Cadmus is introduced for autoregressive program synthesis, enabling controlled experimentation with small models trained to complete true programs.
item.author: Russ Webb, Jason Ramapuram

item.title: Is a secure AI assistant possible?
item.description: MIT Technology Review discusses the risks associated with AI agents, particularly LLMs (Large Language Models), which can make errors even when confined to chat interfaces and pose significant dangers once given access to external tools like web browsers or email.
item.author: Grace Huckins

item.title: The two patterns by which agents connect sandboxes
item.description: More agents are requiring dedicated workspaces to run code, install packages, and access resources efficiently.
item.author: Harrison Chase

item.title: How Do You Define an AI Companion?
item.description: AI companions are gaining popularity among users who seek emotional support and personal assistance from AI models, leading to the growth of apps like Character.ai and Replika.
item.author: Gwendolyn Rak

item.title: Testing ads in ChatGPT
item.description: OpenAI is launching ad-supported services within its AI assistant ChatGPT, offering clear labels, independent answers, strong privacy measures, and user control.

item.title: Accelerating Mathematical and Scientific Discovery with Gemini Deep Think
item.description: Google DeepMind's advanced AI model, Deep Think, has achieved a gold medal in the International Mathematical Olympiad by processing complex mathematical problems.

item.title: Import AI 444: LLM societies; Huawei makes kernels with AI; ChipBench
item.description: A new study by Import AI suggests that large language models (LLMs) can simulate multiple personalities to answer questions, indicating a deeper understanding of human behavior.
item.author: Jack Clark

item.title: Why the Moltbook frenzy was like Pokémon
item.description: Moltbook, an online platform where AI agents interact, was compared to Pokémon due to its dynamic and evolving nature.
item.author: James O'Donnell

item.title: How and When the Memory Chip Shortage Will End
item.description: The shortage in computer memory, particularly DRAM used for AI accelerators, is driving up prices and affecting other markets.
item.author: Samuel K. Moore
